detailed_translations.english: a person who survives a dangerous or difficult situation, or a person who remains after a disaster or battle

sentences.english: You can call our customer service on a toll-free number for assistance.
sentences.chinese: 您可以拨打我们的客服免费电话以获得帮助。

sentences.english: Many companies provide toll-free numbers for their clients to easily reach them.
sentences.chinese: 许多公司为客户提供免费电话，以便他们轻松联系。

detailed_translations.english: not requiring payment for use
a telephone number that allows a caller to make a call without paying for it

sentences.english: We have a 24-hour hotline for customer service.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一个24小时的客户服务热线。

sentences.english: Please call the hotline if you have any emergency.
sentences.chinese: 如果有任何紧急情况，请拨打热线电话。

detailed_translations.english: a direct telephone line providing a quick way of contacting a particular person or organization

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

sentences.english: The fire engine rushed to the scene of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 消防车迅速赶到了事故现场。

sentences.english: The children love to play with the fire engine toys.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们喜欢玩消防车玩具。

sentences.english: The fire engine siren is very loud.
sentences.chinese: 消防车的警笛声非常响亮。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used by fire fighters to go to fires and carry equipment

sentences.english: The police car sirens were loud.
sentences.chinese: 警车的警笛声很响。

sentences.english: He saw a police car parked at the corner.
sentences.chinese: 他看见一辆警车停在拐角处。

sentences.english: The police car quickly approached the scene of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 警车迅速赶到了事故现场。

detailed_translations.english: a car used by the police for patrolling or responding to emergencies

sentences.english: We are currently looking to fill a vacant position in the marketing department.
sentences.chinese: 我们目前正在寻找填补市场部的一个空缺职位。

sentences.english: The job posting clearly outlines the requirements for the vacant position.
sentences.chinese: 招聘广告清楚地概述了空缺职位的任职要求。

sentences.english: Applicants for the vacant position must have at least five years of experience.
sentences.chinese: 申请该空缺职位的申请人必须至少有五年的经验。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空的；未被占用的；失业的
detailed_translations.english: not occupied or used; unemployed
a job that is available because no one is currently doing it

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

sentences.english: She went to a job interview yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 她昨天去参加了一个工作面试。

sentences.english: Prepare well for your job interview.
sentences.chinese: 为你的工作面试做好充分准备。

sentences.english: The job interview lasted for about an hour.
sentences.chinese: 工作面试持续了大约一个小时。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting where someone discusses their qualifications for a job with an employer

sentences.english: The personnel manager is responsible for hiring and training new employees.
sentences.chinese: 人事经理负责招聘和培训新员工。

sentences.english: She needs to ensure that all personnel policies are fair and up-to-date.
sentences.chinese: 她需要确保所有人事政策都是公平和最新的。

detailed_translations.english: a manager who is responsible for the human resources of a company or organization

sentences.english: She is looking for a stable full-time job to support her family.
sentences.chinese: 她在寻找一份稳定的全职工作来支持她的家庭。

sentences.english: Many students work part-time to gain experience, but he prefers a full-time job.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生做兼职以获得经验，但他更喜欢全职工作。

sentences.english: A full-time job usually offers better benefits and career opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 全职工作通常提供更好的福利和职业机会。

detailed_translations.english: working all or most of the days in a working week

sentences.english: She works a part-time job at a local café to earn extra money.
sentences.chinese: 她在当地一家咖啡馆做兼职以赚取额外收入。

sentences.english: Many students take on part-time jobs to support their living expenses.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生做兼职以支持他们的生活费用。

sentences.english: He found a part-time job that fits well with his studies.
sentences.chinese: 他找到了一份与他的学习很相配的兼职工作。

detailed_translations.english: working or done for only part of the normal working hours

sentences.english: The cashier quickly scanned the items and bagged the groceries.
sentences.chinese: 收银员迅速扫描了商品并装袋了杂货。

sentences.english: She worked as a cashier at the local supermarket for five years.
sentences.chinese: 她在当地超市担任收银员五年。

sentences.english: The cashier gave me change for a fifty-dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 收银员给我找了五十美元的零钱。

detailed_translations.english: a person who works in a shop or bank and handles money

sentences.english: The dealer takes a 20% commission on the sales he makes.
sentences.chinese: 经销商按销售额收取20%的佣金。

detailed_translations.english: an extra amount of money that is paid to a person or organization according to the value of the goods they have sold or the services they have provided
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

sentences.english: She works the day shift at the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 她在医院上白班。

sentences.english: Most people prefer the day shift because it ends at a reasonable hour.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人更喜欢白班，因为它在合理的时间结束。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time during the day when people work

sentences.english: Many people find it challenging to adjust to shift work schedules.
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现很难适应轮班工作的时间表。

sentences.english: Shift work often requires workers to be alert and focused during their assigned hours.
sentences.chinese: 轮班工作通常要求工人在指定时间内保持警觉和专注。

sentences.english: Some companies offer flexible shift work to accommodate employees' personal needs.
sentences.chinese: 一些公司提供灵活的轮班工作以适应员工个人需求。

detailed_translations.english: work that is done at different times of the day or night, often involving working evenings, weekends, or holidays

sentences.english: The company used window dressing to make the store look more attractive during the holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司在假日季节利用橱窗装饰使商店看起来更具吸引力。

sentences.english: Be cautious about the window dressing and not the substance of the product being sold.
sentences.chinese: 要小心橱窗装饰，而不是被销售产品的实质所迷惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 橱窗装饰；表面功夫；虚饰
detailed_translations.english: the attractive display of goods in a shop window; superficial appearance or treatment intended to hide a lack of substance

sentences.english: He spends most of his day doing routine work.
sentences.chinese: 他花大部分时间做日常工作。

sentences.english: The employees are tired of doing the same routine work every day.
sentences.chinese: 员工们厌倦了每天做同样的日常工作。

detailed_translations.english: normal, everyday tasks that are done regularly

sentences.english: At what age can you start drawing your pension ?
sentences.chinese: 从多少岁可以开始领取养老金？

sentences.english: If you are self-employed, you should think about taking out a private pension .
sentences.chinese: 如果你是自由职业者，应该考虑办理私人养老金事宜。

sentences.english: Many people find it hard to live on a basic state pension .
sentences.chinese: 许多人发现仅凭国家基本养老金不能养活自己。

sentences.english: She pays a quarter of her salary into a pension plan.
sentences.chinese: 她将每月工资的四分之一用于养老金计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 养老金， 抚恤金； 年金
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill

sentences.english: Her annual salary is quite high for her experience level.
sentences.chinese: 她的年薪对于她的经验水平来说相当高。

sentences.english: We need to negotiate the salary for this position.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要协商这个职位的薪水。

sentences.english: He earns a decent salary as a software engineer.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名软件工程师，他挣着一份不错的薪水。

detailed_translations.english: a fixed regular payment, typically paid on a monthly basis, made by an employer to an employee, especially a professional or white-collar worker

sentences.english: He earns a good wage.
sentences.chinese: 他工资挺高。

detailed_translations.english: money you earn that is paid according to the number of hours, days, or weeks that you work

sentences.english: The project presented several challenging obstacles.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目提出了几个具有挑战性的障碍。

sentences.english: She found the new course challenging but rewarding.
sentences.chinese: 她发现这门新课程有挑战性但也很有收获。

sentences.english: Navigating the complex regulations was a challenging task for the team.
sentences.chinese: 应对复杂的法规是团队面临的一项艰巨任务。

detailed_translations.english: requiring effort, skill, or determination; difficult to deal with or overcome

sentences.english: The stimulating environment encourages creativity and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 这个充满刺激的环境鼓励创造力和创新。

sentences.english: She finds the course intellectually stimulating.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得这门课程很有启发性。

sentences.english: The stimulating effects of the new drug were immediate.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药刺激效果立竿见影。

detailed_translations.chinese: 刺激的；有刺激性的；引人入胜的
detailed_translations.english: causing excitement or interest; invigorating

sentences.english: This book provides interesting insights into the history of the civil rights movement.
sentences.chinese: 这本书提供了关于民权运动历史的有趣见解。

sentences.english: The teacher made the lesson on ancient civilizations very interesting for the students.
sentences.chinese: 老师让关于古代文明的课程对学生来说非常有趣。

sentences.english: She found the documentary about animal behavior quite interesting.
sentences.chinese: 她发现关于动物行为的纪录片相当有趣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有趣的；引人入胜的；有价值的
detailed_translations.english: causing someone to want to pay attention to or think about something because it is new, unusual, or amusing

sentences.english: They embarked on a journey full of adventure to discover new lands.
sentences.chinese: 他们踏上了一段充满冒险的旅程，去发现新的土地。

sentences.english: Her life was full of adventure after she moved to the wild west.
sentences.chinese: 她搬到西部后，生活充满了冒险。

detailed_translations.english: characterized by or involving risk, excitement, and the unknown

sentences.english: The bookshelf is organized with the novels on the left and the biographies on the right.
sentences.chinese: 书架整理得很好，小说在左边，传记在右边。

sentences.english: Please place the red box on the left side of the table.
sentences.chinese: 请把红色的箱子放在桌子的左边。

sentences.english: In the kitchen, the dishes are washed on the left and dried on the right.
sentences.chinese: 在厨房里，碗碟在左边洗，在右边干。

detailed_translations.english: to be on the side that is to the left

sentences.english: The book is placed on the right side of the table.
sentences.chinese: 书放在桌子的右侧。

sentences.english: Turn right at the next intersection.
sentences.chinese: 在下一个十字路口右转。

sentences.english: His right hand is stronger than his left.
sentences.chinese: 他的右手比左手更有力。

detailed_translations.english: in or towards the direction that is on the right side

sentences.english: Please turn to the left at the traffic light.
sentences.chinese: 请在红绿灯处向左转。

sentences.english: The map indicates that we should turn to the left to reach the village.
sentences.chinese: 地图显示我们应该向左转才能到达那个村庄。

detailed_translations.english: to change direction and move towards the left side

sentences.english: Please turn to the right at the next intersection.
sentences.chinese: 请在下一个十字路口向右转。

sentences.english: The car turned to the right and disappeared into the side street.
sentences.chinese: 汽车向右转，消失在了一条小巷里。

detailed_translations.english: to make a turn to the right

name: around the corner to the left
ukphone: əˈraʊnd ðə ˈkɔːnə tuː ðə lɛft
usphone: əˈraʊnd ðə ˈkɔrnər tu ðə lɛft

sentences.english: The shop is just around the corner to the left.
sentences.chinese: 商店就在左转角处。

sentences.english: Turn left at the traffic light, and the bank will be around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 在红绿灯处左转，银行就在转角处。

detailed_translations.english: near or not far away; something is about to happen soon

sentences.english: The new supermarket is just around the corner to the right.
sentences.chinese: 那个新的超市就在你右手边不远处。

sentences.english: Turn right at the next corner, and the park will be around the corner to the right.
sentences.chinese: 在下一个拐角处右转，公园就在你右手边不远处。

detailed_translations.english: in or near the immediate vicinity; about to happen

sentences.english: The car was be in front of the house.
sentences.chinese: 那辆车停在房子的前面。

sentences.english: She stood be in front of the class to give a speech.
sentences.chinese: 她站在教室前面演讲。

sentences.english: The flag was be in front of the parade.
sentences.chinese: 旗子走在游行队伍的前面。

detailed_translations.english: to be at the position ahead of someone or something

sentences.english: He is behind in his studies because he missed several classes.
sentences.chinese: 他的学习落后了，因为他错过了几节课。

sentences.english: The project is behind schedule due to unexpected delays.
sentences.chinese: 由于意外的延误，这个项目进度落后了。

sentences.english: She always tries to catch up, but feels behind her peers.
sentences.chinese: 她总是试图赶上，但感觉落后于同龄人。

detailed_translations.english: not keeping up with the expected progress or level
at or to a position behind or further back than a specified or implied point

sentences.english: He was beside himself with joy when he heard the good news.
sentences.chinese: 当听到这个好消息时，他欣喜若狂。

sentences.english: She stood beside her husband during the speech.
sentences.chinese: 她在演讲期间站在丈夫身边。

detailed_translations.english: to be next to or very close to someone or something

sentences.english: The shop is located on the corner of Main Street and Elm Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店位于主街和榆树大道的拐角处。

sentences.english: They met on the corner of the street while waiting for the bus.
sentences.chinese: 他们在街角等公交车时相遇了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在...的角落；位于...的拐角处
detailed_translations.english: to be at the intersection or angle of two streets or areas

sentences.english: The new road is parallel to the old highway.
sentences.chinese: 新修的道路与旧高速公路平行。

sentences.english: The lines on the graph are parallel to each other.
sentences.chinese: 图表上的线条相互平行。

detailed_translations.english: lying or extending in the same direction, parallel to each other

sentences.english: She had to cross the street to get to the store.
sentences.chinese: 她不得不穿过街道去商店。

sentences.english: The ship crossed the Atlantic Ocean in five days.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船五天内穿越了大西洋。

sentences.english: He crossed his fingers hoping for good luck.
sentences.chinese: 他交叉手指，希望好运。

detailed_translations.english: to move from one side of something to the other side
to draw a line through something, especially to show that it is not correct
to become different from something that existed before

sentences.english: The water pipe burst in the basement, causing a flood.
sentences.chinese: 水管在地下室爆了，引发了洪水。

sentences.english: We keep our old furniture in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 我们把旧家具放在地下室。

sentences.english: The basement of the house is very spacious.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子的地下室非常宽敞。

detailed_translations.english: the room or set of rooms below the ground floor of a building

sentences.english: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 沿着这儿走，浴室就在走廊的尽头。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it

sentences.english: He showed a clear path to success.
sentences.chinese: 他指明了通往成功的明确道路。

sentences.english: The lost hikers followed the path of least resistance.
sentences.chinese: 迷路的徒步者沿着阻力最小的路径前行。

sentences.english: She decided to take a different path in life.
sentences.chinese: 她决定走人生的不同道路。

detailed_translations.english: a route or way beaten by travel or used by those going along
a course of action or procedure

sentences.english: He read the passage aloud to the class.
sentences.chinese: 他大声朗读段落给全班听。

sentences.english: The passage discussed the importance of environmental protection.
sentences.chinese: 这段文字讨论了环境保护的重要性。

sentences.english: The passage was filled with difficult vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 这段文字充满了难懂的词汇。

detailed_translations.chinese: passage (名词): 通道； 段落； 课文； 传递
detailed_translations.english: a route or way, especially one that is through a town, city, or building; a section of a book, speech, or article

sentences.english: The village isn’t very well signposted.
sentences.chinese: 这个村子在路标上指示得不是很清楚。

detailed_translations.english: a sign at the side of a road showing directions and distances

sentences.english: The arrow flew straight to the target.
sentences.chinese: 箭头径直飞向了目标。

sentences.english: He shot an arrow from his bow.
sentences.chinese: 他从弓上射出一支箭。

sentences.english: The arrow symbolizes speed and precision.
sentences.chinese: 箭头象征着速度和精确。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin stick with a pointed head, used for shooting at targets or hunting animals
the pointed end of an arrow

sentences.english: Please press the button to call the elevator.
sentences.chinese: 请按按钮呼叫电梯。

sentences.english: The elevator stopped between floors.
sentences.chinese: 电梯在楼层之间停下了。

sentences.english: We took the elevator to the top floor.
sentences.chinese: 我们乘电梯到了顶层。

detailed_translations.english: a cage on a shaft carrying people or goods between floors of a building

sentences.english: The elevator can lift you to the top floor quickly.
sentences.chinese: 电梯可以快速把你送到顶层。

sentences.english: He had to lift the heavy box to move it.
sentences.chinese: 他不得不抬起那个重箱子才能搬走。

sentences.english: The government will lift the restrictions soon.
sentences.chinese: 政府很快将解除限制。

detailed_translations.english: to move something upwards or higher
to increase or improve something
to remove or cancel something, especially a restriction or rule

sentences.english: Take the escalator to the third floor and it's the last office on the left.
sentences.chinese: 乘电梯到4楼，左边最后的那个办公室就是。

detailed_translations.english: a set of moving stairs that take people to different levels in a building

sentences.english: There is a pedestrian crossing near the school.
sentences.chinese: 学校附近有一个行人过街横道。

sentences.english: Please wait at the pedestrian crossing for the green light.
sentences.chinese: 请在大绿灯时在行人过街横道上等待。

detailed_translations.english: a place where pedestrians can cross a road at designated points

sentences.english: We stopped at a zebra crossing to let the children cross the road safely.
sentences.chinese: 我们在斑马线前停下车，让孩子们安全地过马路。

sentences.english: The driver carefully waited for the pedestrians to finish crossing the zebra crossing before proceeding.
sentences.chinese: 司机小心地等待行人完成斑马线上的过马路后才继续行驶。

detailed_translations.english: a marked area across a road where pedestrians can cross safely

name: pelican crossing
trans: 交通指挥灯由行人控制的人行横道

sentences.english: The pelican crossing is a place where pedestrians can safely cross the road.
sentences.chinese: 人行横道是行人可以安全过马路的地方。

sentences.english: We waited at the pelican crossing for the traffic light to turn green.
sentences.chinese: 我们在人行横道等红灯变绿。

detailed_translations.english: a marked area across a road where pedestrians can cross safely

sentences.english: A small group of journalists waited on the pavement outside her house.
sentences.chinese: 有一小群记者守候在她家外面的人行道上。

sentences.english: a pavement cafe
sentences.chinese: 路边咖啡馆

detailed_translations.chinese: 人行道； 地面， 路面
detailed_translations.english: a hard level surface or path at the side of a road for people to walk on

sentences.english: She walked quickly along the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速地沿着人行道走着。

sentences.english: There was a crack in the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 人行道上有一道裂缝。

sentences.english: He sat on the bench at the end of the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在人行道尽头的长椅上。

detailed_translations.english: a path beside a road, intended for pedestrians

sentences.english: The overpass above the highway provides a clear view of the city skyline.
sentences.chinese: 高速公路上的立交桥提供了清晰的市景线视野。

sentences.english: Be cautious when driving under an overpass, as low-hanging branches can be hazardous.
sentences.chinese: 在驶入立交桥下方时请谨慎驾驶，低垂的树枝可能存在危险。

sentences.english: The construction of the new overpass has significantly reduced traffic congestion in the area.
sentences.chinese: 新建立交桥的建成显著减少了该地区的交通拥堵。

detailed_translations.english: a bridge that carries one road over another

sentences.english: The car smoothly drove under the busy highway overpass.
sentences.chinese: 汽车顺畅地驶过了繁忙的公路立交桥下方。

sentences.english: Pedestrians should use the pedestrian underpass to cross the street safely.
sentences.chinese: 行人应该使用人行地下通道安全地过马路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地下通道；立交桥下的通道
detailed_translations.english: an enclosed passageway, typically beneath a road or railway

sentences.english: The road to success is always difficult.
sentences.chinese: 通往成功的道路总是充满艰辛。

sentences.english: We are driving along the road.
sentences.chinese: 我们正沿着道路开车。

sentences.english: The road is blocked by an accident.
sentences.chinese: 这条路被一起事故堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: a way or path on which people, vehicles, or animals travel or are led
a method or route by which something is achieved or progresses

sentences.english: She lives on Elm Street.
sentences.chinese: 她住在榆树街上。

sentences.english: The shop is just down the street.
sentences.chinese: 商店就在街那边。

sentences.english: We walked along the busy street.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着繁忙的街道走着。

detailed_translations.english: a road in a town or city, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides

sentences.english: a quiet country lane
sentences.chinese: 一条宁静的乡间小路

detailed_translations.english: a narrow road in the countryside

sentences.english: The grand boulevard was lined with tall trees and elegant buildings.
sentences.chinese: 宽阔的林荫大道两旁种着高大的树木和优雅的建筑。

sentences.english: We walked along the boulevard, enjoying the lively atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着林荫大道走着，享受着热闹的气氛。

detailed_translations.english: a wide street, especially one lined with trees, often leading to a public place or monument

sentences.english: The situation is far from ideal.
sentences.chinese: 情况远非理想状态。

sentences.english: He is far from finished with his work.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作远未完成。

sentences.english: Her skills are far from sufficient for this job.
sentences.chinese: 她的技能远不足以胜任这份工作。

detailed_translations.english: to be at a considerable distance in space or time; to be completely different from something

sentences.english: There is a park nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近有一个公园。

sentences.english: The restaurant is nearby, so we decided to walk there.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅就在附近，所以我们决定步行过去。

sentences.english: He moved to a house nearby to be closer to his job.
sentences.chinese: 他搬到了附近的房子，以便更靠近他的工作地点。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place not far away

sentences.english: You should go straight across the street to reach the other side.
sentences.chinese: 你应该直穿过马路到达对面。

sentences.english: The path goes straight across the field.
sentences.chinese: 小路直穿过田野。

detailed_translations.english: to move in a direct line without turning or deviating

sentences.english: He walked through the forest to reach the other side.
sentences.chinese: 他穿过森林到达了另一边。

sentences.english: She read through the report quickly to get a general idea.
sentences.chinese: 她快速地浏览了报告以了解大概内容。

sentences.english: The team went through a lot of challenges to complete the project on time.
sentences.chinese: 为了按时完成项目，团队经历了很多挑战。

detailed_translations.english: to move from one side or end to the other of something
completely or fully
to experience something or to examine something carefully

sentences.english: We need to cross over to the other side of the river.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要渡过河到另一边。

sentences.english: The train will cross over to the other track.
sentences.chinese: 火车将切换到另一条轨道。

detailed_translations.english: to move from one side to the other side of something

sentences.english: The house is next to the park.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子紧挨着公园。

sentences.english: She sat next to him during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 她在会议上坐在他旁边。

sentences.english: The supermarket is next to the library.
sentences.chinese: 超市就在图书馆旁边。

detailed_translations.english: to be beside or very close to something or someone

sentences.english: The price of the stock went up today.
sentences.chinese: 今天的股价上涨了。

sentences.english: Our expenses have gone up significantly over the past year.
sentences.chinese: 我们过去一年的开支显著增加了。

sentences.english: The temperature is going up, it's getting warmer.
sentences.chinese: 温度正在上升，天越来越暖和了。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in amount, level, or degree

sentences.english: The prices are going down due to increased competition.
sentences.chinese: 由于竞争加剧，价格正在下降。

sentences.english: His stock portfolio went down significantly after the market crash.
sentences.chinese: 在市场崩盘后，他的股票投资组合大幅下跌。

sentences.english: The economy went down during the recession.
sentences.chinese: 在经济衰退期间，经济状况下滑。

detailed_translations.english: to decrease in value, amount, or quality; to decline

sentences.english: If you don't like the job, you can always go back to school.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不喜欢这份工作，你可以总是回去上学。

sentences.english: He went back to his old job after leaving it for a year.
sentences.chinese: 离开那家公司一年后，他回到了他的老工作。

sentences.english: We need to go back to the drawing board to rethink our strategy.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要回去重新思考我们的策略。

detailed_translations.english: to return to a previous place or situation, or to return to doing something that you were doing before

sentences.english: If you have a good reason, you can go on working from home.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有正当理由，可以继续在家工作。

sentences.english: The movie went on for three hours, and it was quite engaging.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影持续了三个小时，而且相当引人入胜。

sentences.english: We went on despite the rain, determined to reach our destination.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雨，我们还是继续前进，决心到达目的地。

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing something
to continue in the same state or at the same rate

sentences.english: We walked along the riverbank until the sun set.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着河岸走，直到太阳落山。

sentences.english: She worked on the project along with her team until it was completed.
sentences.chinese: 她和她的团队一起工作，直到项目完成。

sentences.english: They talked along the street until they found the right address.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿街交谈，直到找到正确的地址。

detailed_translations.english: in a direction parallel to the course of something
up to a certain point in time or until a certain condition is met

name: be the first from the left
ukphone: biː ðə fɜːst frɒm ðə lɛft
usphone: bi ðə fɜrst frʌm ðə lɛft

sentences.english: Be the first from the left to reach the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 从左边第一个到达终点。

sentences.english: Please be the first from the left to stand up.
sentences.chinese: 请从左边第一个站起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为第一个；从左边第一个开始
detailed_translations.english: to be in the position one; to start from the leftmost side

sentences.english: She’s quite shy, the exact opposite of Becky.
sentences.chinese: 她非常害羞，和贝姬正好相反。

sentences.english: The two men were complete opposites – Simon tall and fair, Clive short and dark.
sentences.chinese: 这两人完全相反——西蒙高而白，克莱夫矮而黑。

sentences.english: If anything, the opposite was true.
sentences.chinese: 一定要说什么的话，那就是情况正好相反。

sentences.english: Is it sensible to think of masculine/feminine as polar opposites (= exactly or completely opposite )?
sentences.chinese: 把阳刚和阴柔看成完全的对立面是否有道理？

detailed_translations.english: a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

sentences.english: The store is located across from the library.
sentences.chinese: 商店位于图书馆对面。

sentences.english: We sat across from each other at the table.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在桌子的对面彼此相对。

detailed_translations.english: at or to the other side of (something)

sentences.english: The main entrance is located behind the large tree.
sentences.chinese: 主入口位于那棵大树后面。

sentences.english: The office is located behind the reception desk.
sentences.chinese: 办公室位于接待台后面。

sentences.english: The warehouse is located behind the factory.
sentences.chinese: 仓库位于工厂后面。

detailed_translations.english: to be in a position that is at the back or behind something

sentences.english: He was left sitting in the corner of the room, feeling ignored.
sentences.chinese: 他被留坐在房间的角落里，感觉被忽视了。

sentences.english: The old clock stood in the corner of the hallway.
sentences.chinese: 那座旧钟立在走廊的角落里。

detailed_translations.english: to be located at or in the area towards the side or end of something, especially a room or building

sentences.english: Take a step back and think about the situation.
sentences.chinese: 后退一步，思考一下情况。

sentences.english: She made a step forward to greet him.
sentences.chinese: 她向前一步向他打招呼。

sentences.english: We need to take the next step in the project.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要在项目中迈出下一步。

detailed_translations.english: a position or stage in a process of development
to move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

sentences.english: This building has wheelchair access for visitors.
sentences.chinese: 这座建筑为访客提供了轮椅通道。

sentences.english: Wheelchair access is important for ensuring equality.
sentences.chinese: 轮椅通道对于确保平等至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 轮椅通道；轮椅无障碍设施
detailed_translations.english: the ability to enter and use a building or vehicle using a wheelchair

sentences.english: We crossed at a busy intersection.
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过了一个繁忙的道路交叉口。

detailed_translations.chinese: 道路交叉口， 十字路口
detailed_translations.english: a place where roads, lines etc cross each other, especially where two roads meet

sentences.english: We arrived at a crossroad where we had to decide which direction to take.
sentences.chinese: 我们来到一个十字路口，必须决定要走向哪个方向。

sentences.english: At the crossroad of history, she made a choice that changed everything.
sentences.chinese: 在历史的十字路口，她做了一个改变一切的选择。

detailed_translations.english: a point where two or more roads intersect; a situation where a difficult choice has to be made

sentences.english: At the fork on the road, he had to decide which path to take.
sentences.chinese: 在岔路口，他不得不决定走哪条路。

sentences.english: The story is a metaphor for life, with many forks in the road.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事是生活的隐喻，充满了许多岔路口。

detailed_translations.english: a point where a road splits into two or more different directions

sentences.english: The road ahead was narrow and winding.
sentences.chinese: 前方的道路狭窄而曲折。

sentences.english: They took a shortcut through the back road.
sentences.chinese: 他们抄了条近路穿过小路。

detailed_translations.english: a route or way, typically one used for travel or transport

sentences.english: The shop is on the ground floor of the building.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店在建筑物的底层。

sentences.english: We live on the ground floor of our house.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在我们房子的底层。

detailed_translations.english: the lowest floor of a building that is not divided into separate rooms for different purposes

sentences.english: She wore a white wing tip shoe for the interview.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一双白色船鞋去面试。

sentences.english: The bird spread its wings and flew into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿展开翅膀飞向天空。

sentences.english: The airplane's wings were damaged in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的机翼在暴风雨中受损。

detailed_translations.english: a structure on the body of an animal that enables it to fly
a side or auxiliary part of something
to equip with wings

sentences.english: The government decided to annex the territory to expand its borders.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定吞并该领土以扩大其边界。

sentences.english: They plan to annex the small company to increase their market share.
sentences.chinese: 他们计划吞并这家小公司以增加其市场份额。

detailed_translations.english: to take control of a country, area, or organization and add it to your own country or organization

sentences.english: The Twin Towers were iconic landmarks of New York City.
sentences.chinese: 双塔曾是纽约市的标志性建筑。

sentences.english: The two buildings are mirror images of each other, forming a unique architectural pair.
sentences.chinese: 这两座建筑互为镜像，形成了一个独特的建筑对。

detailed_translations.english: a pair of buildings that are very similar in design and appearance

sentences.english: One of Belfast’s most famous landmarks, the Grosvenor Hall, has been demolished.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔法斯特最著名的地标之一格罗夫纳大厦已被拆毁了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 路标， 地标； 里程碑
detailed_translations.english: something that is easy to recognize, such as a tall tree or building, and that helps you know where you are

sentences.english: Belfast is the capital city of Northern Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔法斯特是北爱尔兰的首府。

sentences.english: The Grand Opera House in Belfast is a famous landmark.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔法斯特的大歌剧院是一个著名的地标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 地名；贝尔法斯特（北爱尔兰的首府）
detailed_translations.english: the capital city of Northern Ireland, located on the River Lagan

sentences.english: Birmingham is a major city in the West Midlands region of England.
sentences.chinese: 伯明翰是英格兰西米德兰地区的一座主要城市。

sentences.english: The city is known for its industrial heritage and vibrant cultural scene.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市以其工业遗产和充满活力的文化场景而闻名。

sentences.english: Birmingham is home to a diverse population and numerous universities.
sentences.chinese: 伯明翰拥有多元化的人口和众多大学。

detailed_translations.chinese: （英国英格兰西米德兰地区的一座主要城市）
detailed_translations.english: a large city in England, known for its industry and cultural diversity

sentences.english: Cardiff is the capital city of Wales.
sentences.chinese: 卡迪夫是威尔士的首府。

sentences.english: We visited Cardiff Castle during our trip to Wales.
sentences.chinese: 我们在威尔士之行中参观了卡迪夫城堡。

detailed_translations.english: the capital city of Wales, United Kingdom

sentences.english: Coventry is a city in the West Midlands of England.
sentences.chinese: 考文垂是英国西米德兰兹地区的一座城市。

sentences.english: Coventry is known for its automotive and aerospace industries.
sentences.chinese: 考文垂以其汽车和航空航天工业而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: a city in the West Midlands of England, famous for its automotive and aerospace industries

sentences.english: Edinburgh is a historic city in Scotland, known for its rich cultural heritage and annual arts festival.
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡是苏格兰一座历史悠久的城市，以其丰富的文化遗产和年度艺术节而闻名。

sentences.english: The Royal Mile is the main thoroughfare in Edinburgh's Old Town.
sentences.chinese: 皇家一英里是爱丁堡老城区的主要街道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 城市（尤指苏格兰首府爱丁堡）
detailed_translations.english: a city, especially the capital of Scotland

sentences.english: England is known for its rich cultural heritage and historical landmarks.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰以其丰富的文化遗产和历史地标而闻名。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit England to experience its vibrant cities and stunning countryside.
sentences.chinese: 许多游客访问英格兰以体验其充满活力的城市和迷人的乡村。

detailed_translations.chinese: 英格兰；英国（指英格兰部分）
detailed_translations.english: the southern part of the United Kingdom, consisting of nine historic counties and the City of London

sentences.english: Leeds is a city in West Yorkshire, England.
sentences.chinese: 利兹是英国西约克郡的一座城市。

sentences.english: Leeds has a large student population due to its universities.
sentences.chinese: 利兹因其大学众多而拥有庞大的学生群体。

detailed_translations.english: a large town or city in a particular country

sentences.english: Liverpool is a major port city in the North West of England.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦是英格兰西北部的一座主要港口城市。

sentences.english: The Liverpool Football Club is one of the most famous clubs in the world.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦足球俱乐部是世界上最有名的俱乐部之一。

sentences.english: Liverpool has a rich maritime history and is home to the iconic Liver Building.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦拥有丰富的航海历史，是标志性的Liver大楼的所在地。

detailed_translations.english: a large town or city

sentences.english: London is the capital city of England.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦是英格兰的首都。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit London every year to see its famous landmarks.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有许多游客参观伦敦，以瞻仰其著名的地标。

detailed_translations.english: a large city, especially one that is a centre of government, business, or culture

sentences.english: Manchester is a city in North West England, known for its industrial heritage and football team.
sentences.chinese: 曼彻斯特是英格兰西北部的一座城市，以其工业遗产和足球队而闻名。

sentences.english: The University of Manchester is one of the largest and most prestigious universities in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 曼彻斯特大学是英国最大和最负盛名的高等学府之一。

detailed_translations.english: a large town or city

sentences.english: Northern Ireland is one of the four constituent parts of the United Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰是联合王国的四个组成部分之一。

sentences.english: The political status of Northern Ireland is complex and has been a source of conflict.
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰的政治地位复杂，一直是冲突的根源。

detailed_translations.english: a region of the United Kingdom on the island of Ireland

sentences.english: Scotland is known for its beautiful landscapes and rich history.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰以其美丽的风景和丰富的历史而闻名。

sentences.english: Edinburgh, the capital of Scotland, is a popular tourist destination.
sentences.chinese: 爱丁堡，苏格兰的首都，是一个受欢迎的旅游目的地。

detailed_translations.english: a country in northwestern Europe, part of the United Kingdom

sentences.english: Sheffield is a city in South Yorkshire, England.
sentences.chinese: 谢菲尔德是英国南约克郡的一座城市。

sentences.english: Sheffield is known for its steel industry and green spaces.
sentences.chinese: 谢菲尔德以其钢铁工业和绿地而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: a large town or city

sentences.english: Wales is a country that is part of the United Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士是联合王国的一个国家。

sentences.english: The capital of Wales is Cardiff.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士的首都是卡迪夫。

sentences.english: Wales is known for its beautiful landscapes and rich history.
sentences.chinese: 威尔士以其美丽的风景和丰富的历史而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: a country in the United Kingdom that is on the western side of Great Britain

sentences.english: Dublin is the capital city of Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林是爱尔兰的首都。

sentences.english: We visited the Trinity College in Dublin during our trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们在都柏林旅行期间参观了三一学院。

sentences.english: Dublin is famous for its vibrant nightlife and historic sites.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林以其充满活力的夜生活和历史遗迹而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: the capital of Ireland

sentences.english: Adelaide is the capital city of South Australia.
sentences.chinese: 阿德莱德是澳大利亚南部的首府城市。

sentences.english: The Adelaide Festival Centre hosts a variety of cultural events throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 阿德莱德艺术节中心全年举办各种文化活动。

detailed_translations.english: the capital city of South Australia

sentences.english: Brisbane is a beautiful city in Queensland, Australia.
sentences.chinese: 布里斯班是澳大利亚昆士兰州的一座美丽城市。

sentences.english: Many people visit Brisbane for its sunny beaches and vibrant culture.
sentences.chinese: 许多人来到布里斯班是为了它的阳光海滩和充满活力的文化。

detailed_translations.chinese: 城市（澳大利亚昆士兰州首府）
detailed_translations.english: a city in Queensland, Australia, which is known for its subtropical climate and outdoor lifestyle

sentences.english: Canberra is the capital city of Australia.
sentences.chinese: 堪培拉是澳大利亚的首都。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Canberra to see the Australian War Memorial.
sentences.chinese: 许多游客会参观堪培拉以参观澳大利亚战争纪念馆。

detailed_translations.english: the capital city of Australia

sentences.english: Cairns is a popular tourist destination in Queensland, Australia.
sentences.chinese: 凯恩斯是澳大利亚昆士兰州一个受欢迎的旅游目的地。

sentences.english: We stayed at a cozy hotel in Cairns and explored the Great Barrier Reef the next day.
sentences.chinese: 我们在凯恩斯住在一个舒适酒店，第二天探索了大堡礁。

detailed_translations.chinese: （澳大利亚昆士兰州的）城市；（尤指去昆士兰州东北部海岸的）旅游中转站
detailed_translations.english: a town in Queensland, Australia, known for tourism and access to the Great Barrier Reef

sentences.english: Melbourne is known for its vibrant cultural scene and beautiful coffee culture.
sentences.chinese: 墨尔本以其充满活力的文化场景和美丽的咖啡文化而闻名。

sentences.english: Many people visit Melbourne to experience its stunning architecture and outdoor activities.
sentences.chinese: 许多人访问墨尔本以体验其令人惊叹的建筑和户外活动。

detailed_translations.english: the capital city of Victoria, Australia

sentences.english: Sydney, the capital of New South Wales, is one of Australia's largest cities.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼是新南威尔士州的首府，也是澳大利亚最大的城市之一。

sentences.english: New South Wales is known for its beautiful beaches and scenic mountains.
sentences.chinese: 新南威尔士州以其美丽的海滩和风景如画的山脉而闻名。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新南威尔士州 (澳大利亚的一个州)
detailed_translations.english: a state in the south-east of Australia

sentences.english: Perth is a beautiful city located in Western Australia.
sentences.chinese: 珀斯是位于西澳大利亚州的一座美丽城市。

sentences.english: We enjoyed our trip to Perth and visited many interesting places.
sentences.chinese: 我们很享受在珀斯的旅行，参观了许多有趣的地方。

detailed_translations.english: a city in Western Australia

sentences.english: Queensland is known for its beautiful beaches and tropical climate.
sentences.chinese: 昆士兰以其美丽的海滩和热带气候而闻名。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Queensland each year to enjoy its natural wonders.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有许多游客参观昆士兰以欣赏其自然奇观。

detailed_translations.english: a state in the northeast of Australia, known for its beaches, rainforests, and Great Barrier Reef

sentences.english: Sydney Opera House is a landmark of modern architecture.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼歌剧院是现代建筑的标志。

sentences.english: We spent a wonderful weekend exploring Sydney's beaches.
sentences.chinese: 我们在悉尼的海滩上度过了一个美好的周末。

sentences.english: Sydney is known for its vibrant cultural scene.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼以其充满活力的文化场景而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: a large Australian city, capital of the state of New South Wales

sentences.english: Victoria is known for its beautiful gardens and historic buildings.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚以其美丽的花园和历史建筑而闻名。

sentences.english: The Victoria Falls are one of the world's most impressive waterfalls.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚瀑布是世界上最具 впечатляющие 瀑布之一。

sentences.english: She is a descendant of Queen Victoria.
sentences.chinese: 她是维多利亚女王的直系后代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 维多利亚（人名；地名；女王名）
detailed_translations.english: a city in British Columbia, Canada; the period of Queen Victoria's reign in the United Kingdom

sentences.english: Auckland is the largest city in New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 奥克兰是新西兰最大的城市。

sentences.english: The Sky Tower in Auckland offers stunning views of the city skyline.
sentences.chinese: 奥克兰的天空塔提供了令人惊叹的城市天际线景色。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Auckland to enjoy its beautiful beaches.
sentences.chinese: 许多游客访问奥克兰以享受其美丽的海滩。

detailed_translations.english: a city or town, especially a large one

sentences.english: Christchurch is a city in the South Island of New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 基督城是新西兰南岛的一座城市。

sentences.english: The Christchurch earthquake of 2011 caused significant damage to the city.
sentences.chinese: 2011年的基督城地震对这座城市造成了重大破坏。

detailed_translations.english: a city in the South Island of New Zealand

sentences.english: Wellington is the capital city of New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 惠灵顿是新西兰的首都。

sentences.english: The Wellington cable car offers stunning views of the city and harbor.
sentences.chinese: 惠灵顿缆车提供了令人惊叹的城市和港口美景。

detailed_translations.english: a city in New Zealand, the capital of the country

sentences.english: British Columbia is known for its stunning natural landscapes, including mountains, forests, and coastlines.
sentences.chinese: 不列颠哥伦比亚省以其壮丽的自然风光而闻名，包括山脉、森林和海岸线。

sentences.english: Vancouver, the largest city in British Columbia, is a major cultural and economic hub in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 温哥华是不列颠哥伦比亚省最大的城市，是加拿大重要的文化和经济中心。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不列颠哥伦比亚省（加拿大省名）
detailed_translations.english: a province on the western coast of Canada known for its natural beauty and diverse communities

sentences.english: Montreal is a major city in the province of Quebec, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特利尔是加拿大魁北克省的一个主要城市。

sentences.english: The Montreal Exchange is one of the world's largest derivatives exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特利尔交易所是世界上最大的衍生品交易所之一。

sentences.english: Montreal hosts many international conferences and events throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特利尔每年都会举办许多国际会议和活动。

detailed_translations.english: a city in southern Quebec, Canada, known for its cultural diversity and winter festivals

sentences.english: Ontario is one of the most populous provinces in Canada.
sentences.chinese: 安大略省是加拿大人口最多的省份之一。

sentences.english: The Niagara Falls are located on the border of Ontario and New York.
sentences.chinese: 尼亚加拉大瀑布位于安大略省和纽约州的边界上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 加拿大安大略省；安大略湖
detailed_translations.english: a province in southeastern Canada on the Great Lakes

sentences.english: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada.
sentences.chinese: 渥太华是加拿大的首都。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Ottawa each year to see its historic sites.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有许多游客到渥太华参观其历史遗迹。

sentences.english: Ottawa is known for its beautiful parks and rivers.
sentences.chinese: 渥太华以其美丽的公园和河流而闻名。

detailed_translations.english: a city or town, especially a large one

sentences.english: Quebec is a province in eastern Canada known for its French-speaking population.
sentences.chinese: 魁北克是加拿大东部的一个省份，以其法语人口而闻名。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Quebec City to see its historic architecture.
sentences.chinese: 许多游客参观魁北克城，以欣赏其历史建筑。

detailed_translations.english: a province in eastern Canada

sentences.english: Toronto is the capital city of Ontario, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 多伦多是加拿大安大略省的首府。

sentences.english: The CN Tower in Toronto offers stunning views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 多伦多的CN塔提供了令人惊叹的城市景观。

detailed_translations.english: a city in southern Ontario, Canada, on the northwestern shore of Lake Ontario

sentences.english: Vancouver is a beautiful city located in British Columbia, Canada.
sentences.chinese: 温哥华是一座位于加拿大不列颠哥伦比亚省的美丽城市。

sentences.english: Many people visit Vancouver to see its stunning natural scenery, including the Rocky Mountains and the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参观温哥华是为了欣赏其壮丽的自然风光，包括落基山脉和太平洋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 城市（加拿大不列颠哥伦比亚省）
detailed_translations.english: a city in British Columbia, Canada

sentences.english: Victoria has a passion for environmental conservation.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚对环境保护充满热情。

sentences.english: The Victoria Falls are one of the most spectacular natural wonders in the world.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚瀑布是世界上最壮观的自然奇观之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 维多利亚（女王的称号或名字）；维多利亚风格
detailed_translations.english: the title or reign of a British monarch named Victoria; a style of architecture and design fashionable in the late 19th century

sentences.english: Atlanta is the capital city of Georgia, known for its vibrant music scene and historic districts.
sentences.chinese: 亚特兰大是乔治亚州的首府，以其充满活力的音乐场景和历史悠久的地区而闻名。

sentences.english: The 1996 Olympic Games were held in Atlanta, attracting millions of visitors to the city.
sentences.chinese: 1996年奥运会在亚特兰大举行，吸引了数百万游客来到这座城市。

detailed_translations.chinese: 亚特兰大（美国乔治亚州城市）
detailed_translations.english: a city in the southeastern part of the United States, the capital of Georgia state

sentences.english: Boston is a city in Massachusetts, known for its rich history and vibrant culture.
sentences.chinese: 波士顿是马萨诸塞州的一座城市，以其丰富的历史和充满活力的文化而闻名。

sentences.english: The Boston Marathon is one of the most prestigious long-distance running races in the world.
sentences.chinese: 波士顿马拉松是世界上最具声望的长距离跑步比赛之一。

detailed_translations.english: a city in Massachusetts, USA, known for its universities, history, and cultural institutions

sentences.english: Chicago is known for its vibrant arts scene and architecture.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥以其充满活力的艺术场景和建筑而闻名。

sentences.english: We took a day trip to visit the Art Institute of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我们花了一天时间去参观芝加哥艺术博物馆。

sentences.english: The Chicago skyline is one of the most iconic in the world.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥的天际线是世界上最具标志性的之一。

detailed_translations.english: a major city in the state of Illinois, USA, known for its architecture, culture, and importance in American history

sentences.english: Detroit is known for its automotive industry.
sentences.chinese: 底特律以其汽车工业而闻名。

sentences.english: Many people lost their jobs when the factories in Detroit closed.
sentences.chinese: 当底特律的工厂关闭时，许多人失去了他们的工作。

detailed_translations.english: a city in the United States, famous for its car industry

sentences.english: Houston is the largest city in Texas, known for its vibrant culture and energy industry.
sentences.chinese: 休斯顿是德克萨斯州最大的城市，以其充满活力的文化和能源产业而闻名。

sentences.english: We took a guided tour of the Space Center in Houston.
sentences.chinese: 我们在休斯顿参观了太空中心，并参加了导游团。

detailed_translations.english: a large city in a particular country

sentences.english: Los Angeles is known for its beautiful beaches and vibrant nightlife.
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶以其美丽的海滩和充满活力的夜生活而闻名。

sentences.english: Many celebrities live in Los Angeles, making it a hub for entertainment.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人住在洛杉矶，使其成为娱乐中心。

detailed_translations.english: a large city with many people living and working in it

sentences.english: New York is a bustling city known for its skyscrapers and vibrant culture.
sentences.chinese: 纽约是一座繁华的城市，以其摩天大楼和充满活力的文化而闻名。

sentences.english: Many people travel to New York for its world-class entertainment and shopping.
sentences.chinese: 许多人前往纽约，是为了其世界级的娱乐和购物。

detailed_translations.english: a major city in the United States, known for its importance in finance, culture, and media

sentences.english: Philadelphia is known for its rich history and vibrant culture.
sentences.chinese: 费城以其丰富的历史和充满活力的文化而闻名。

sentences.english: The Liberty Bell is a famous landmark in Philadelphia.
sentences.chinese: 自由钟是费城的一个著名地标。

detailed_translations.chinese: 费城（美国宾夕法尼亚州最大城市）
detailed_translations.english: a city in Pennsylvania, USA, known for its history and culture

sentences.english: San Francisco is known for its steep hills and vibrant culture.
sentences.chinese: 旧金山以其陡峭的山坡和充满活力的文化而闻名。

sentences.english: Many people visit San Francisco for its famous landmarks like the Golden Gate Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 许多人参观旧金山是为了看看著名的金门大桥等地标。

detailed_translations.english: a large city with many people who live and work there

sentences.english: Seattle is known for its beautiful bridges and waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 西雅图以其美丽的桥梁和海滨而闻名。

sentences.english: Many tech companies are headquartered in Seattle.
sentences.chinese: 许多科技公司总部设在西雅图。

detailed_translations.english: a city in the northwestern part of the US state of Washington

sentences.english: Washington D.C. is the capital city of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿特区是美国的首都。

sentences.english: Many tourists visit Washington D.C. every year to see famous landmarks like the白宫.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有许多游客访问华盛顿特区，以参观白宫等著名地标。

detailed_translations.english: the capital city of the United States, located on the Potomac River
